hint: To travel across water using wind power.
To make a sudden attack on an enemy or an area, often to steal things.
To travel to new places to discover new lands.
To steal goods violently, especially during wartime or raiding.
To engage in combat or fighting.
To overcome and take control of a place or people by military force.
To exchange goods or services with others.
To establish a permanent home in a new country or region.
To construct something, like a longship or a settlement.
To engage in a violent struggle or contest.
To propel a boat using oars.
To make or shape (a metal object) by heating it in a fire or furnace and beating or hammering it.
To pursue and kill (wild animals) for sport or food.
To form (fabric or an article) by interlacing long threads passing in one direction with others at right angles to them.
To hear and attend to the sagas or stories being told.
To travel from one place to another, often a long distance.
To exchange (goods or services) for other goods or services without using money.
To make something ready for use or consideration.
To enter a country or region by force in order to subjugate or occupy it.
To give up something valued for the sake of something else regarded as more important or worthy, often to the gods.
